Issues.Title: Wrong example of FormRecord usage
Issues.Body:
### Description

Docs got an example which goes like this

> 
> FormRecord accepts one generic argument, which describes the type of the controls it contains.
```
let numbers = new FormRecord({bill: '415-123-456'});
numbers.addControl('bob', '415-234-567');
numbers.removeControl('bill');
```

But when I use that example in my code I got an error

```
let numbers = new FormRecord({bill: '415-123-456'}); // TS2322: Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'AbstractControl<never, never>'. 
numbers.addControl('bob', '415-234-567'); // TS2345: Argument of type 'string' is not assignable to parameter of type 'AbstractControl '.

```

### What is the affected URL?

https://angular.io/api/forms/FormRecord

### Please provide the steps to reproduce the issue

1. Use FormRecord as docs says
2. Look at Typescript compiler errors

### Please provide the expected behavior vs the actual behavior you encountered

I expect to use example from docs and get 0 errors.

### Please provide a screenshot if possible

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
TS2322: Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'AbstractControl<never, never>'. 
TS2345: Argument of type 'string' is not assignable to parameter of type 'AbstractControl '.
```


### Is this a browser-specific issue? If so, please specify the device, browser, and version.

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Wrong example of FormRecord usage" (#46298)

Issues.Title: Type 'ModuleWithProviders<...>' is not assignable to type 'any[] | Type<any>' in v14
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

After I upgrade my project to v14 I got an error in the component imports:
```
Type 'ModuleWithProviders<FormlyModule>' is not assignable to type 'any[] | Type<any>'.
  Type 'ModuleWithProviders<FormlyModule>' is missing the following properties from type 'Type<any>': apply, call, bind, prototype, and 5 more.
```
(In v13 I use `forChild` in `ngModule`)

The `FormlyModule` has a configuration for the child module and this must declare in the component level. [here another example from formly](https://github.com/ngx-formly/ngx-formly/blob/main/src/ui/material/checkbox/src/checkbox.module.ts#L20)

```
@Component({
  standalone: true,
  selector: 'app-root',
  templateUrl: './app.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./app.component.scss'],
  imports: [FormlyModule.forChild({ extras: { lazyRender: true } })], //<--- the error is here
})
export class AppComponent {
  title = 'ng-v14';
}
```

Anyway, my project is not compile. is there a fix or workaround?



### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/github-phmuus?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts,src%2Fapp%2Fapp.module.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Type 'ModuleWithProviders<FormlyModule>' is not assignable to type 'any[] | Type<any>'.
  Type 'ModuleWithProviders<FormlyModule>' is missing the following properties from type 'Type<any>': apply, call, bind, prototype, and 5 more.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 14.0.0
Node: 16.13.0
Package Manager: npm 8.11.0
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 14.0.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1400.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   14.0.0
@angular-devkit/core            14.0.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      14.0.0
@schematics/angular             14.0.0
rxjs                            7.5.5
typescript                      4.7.3
```
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: zone.js Mocha patch regression in v0.11.5
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

The patch for `it.skip` disappeared in v0.11.5.

zone.js v0.11.4, `fesm2015/zone-testing.js`, line 1061:

```javascript
    global.xit = global.xspecify = Mocha.it.skip = function () {
        return mochaOriginal.it.skip.apply(this, wrapTestInZone(arguments));
    };
```

zone.js v0.11.5, line 1061:

```javascript
    global.xit = global.xspecify = function () {
        return mochaOriginal.it.skip.apply(this, wrapTestInZone(arguments));
    };
```

The function [is still part of the Mocha API](https://mochajs.org/#inclusive-tests) and shouldn't have been removed.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
it.skip is not a function
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 14.0.0
Node: 16.13.2
Package Manager: npm 8.3.2 
OS: linux x64

Angular: 14.0.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------

Issues.Title: @Output not working properly from global context even with ngzone.run()
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Description

If for `@Output` you create a callback in a global context (for example, as a property of a `window` object) and then try to emits events from this callback, only the first call will work. Further attempts to make emits will not work even with `ngzone.run()`.

You can see this bug on [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/github/KostyaTretyak/angular-global-output-bug?file=src%2Fapp%2Fchild.component.ts) or on [my repository](https://github.com/KostyaTretyak/angular-global-output-bug). If you try to click the "first" link and then the "second" link, everything will work as expected. But if you try to do it again, when you click on "second" you will not see the output message from the child `mesage from child @Output`.

In my case, I created several child components, each of which works with its vendor to login through social networks (Facebook, Google, etc.). These vendors call callbacks from a global context. In this case, I can't rely on using `@Output` because they don't work properly.

### Environment

```true
Angular CLI: 13.3.7
Node: 16.15.0
Package Manager: yarn 1.22.1
OS: linux x64

Angular: 13.3.11
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1303.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular   13.3.7
@angular-devkit/core            13.3.7
@angular-devkit/schematics      13.3.7
@angular/cli                    13.3.7
@schematics/angular             13.3.7
rxjs                            7.5.5
typescript                      4.6.4
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "@Output not working properly from global context even with ngzone.run()" (#46288)

Issues.Title: test: do not depend on a global npm binary
Issues.Body:
When sandboxed in bazel there is no accessible npm and it must be installed manually some way or another. The npm shipped with node is also not accessible (see https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/pull/3467).

This npm is for the test-runner to install the packages being tested, not for the tests themselves which use a custom cli/npm/yarn within the test process.

ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…-->

# ðŸš€ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- âœï¸edit: -->

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

Regarding the new experimental `@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser-esbuild` builder, it would be great if you could expose a way to set esbuild options via configuration, specifically the `external` option is what I'm looking for at the moment to ensure externalized code (consumed/shared at runtime via ESM from a CDN) is not included in the Angular bundle (we want to use bare module specifiers and import maps).

For context, we are using `@angular/elements` combined with the new esbuild builder to share a custom element across applications, and consume shared ESM dependencies in both the application and custom element. We use typings from an npm package locally for the bare module specifier, but `importmap` at runtime to route it to the CDN.

I know this builder is experimental still, but I figured you would be interested in understanding how we're attempting to use it.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I would expect to provide these options via `angular.json`. Something along the lines of an `esbuildOptions` property that will get passed directly down to esbuild.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I've modified the `node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/builders/browser-esbuild/esbuild.js` file locally for testing purposes to get by for now which works, but otherwise I'll need to fork this repo to produce my own build that supports this until it's implemented in the main package. If this isn't something on your radar any time soon please let me know and I could create a PR when it comes time for us needing to put more priority on this.

Also, if you know of an alternative workaround to pass the config for the short term please let me know!

Issues.Title: ng build --production does not fully uglify js classes
Issues.Body:
# ðŸž Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->

ng build --configuration production

- [ ] new
- [ x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Is this a regression?

No

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->

Same, minification/uglification still appears to be incomplete or is this by design and intentional?

### Description

When creating a production angular build the output javascript bundles seem to be minified and uglified, but not to the extent that I was expecting.

When looking into the outputted files in the dist folder, parts of the file are indeed minified and uglified. Other parts of the file are in plain javascript and expose quite a lot about the application.

I have attached an example image whereby one can clearly read the app component in the main bundle after being minified and uglified. I would have expected this code to have been obfuscated too.


## ðŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction

ng new repro-app

Ensure optimization is enabled on angular json for production

ng build --configuration production

Review the outputted bundles and see that for most angular components, the source code is human readable

## ðŸŒ Your Environment

node v18
npm v8

![Screenshot 2022-06-07 at 11 21 26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107034467/172570772-e26ba678-c39f-408c-877d-daff621aa448.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ng build --production does not fully uglify js classes" (#23317)

Issues.Title: PWA ng-add schematic does not work if bootstrapApplication is used
Issues.Body:
# ðŸž Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [x] generate - [x] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? In the previous version of Angular (13) there was no support for standalone components. ### Description The ng-add schematic for the package `@angular/pwa` does not work if the app bootstraps using `bootstrapApplication` from `@angular/platform-browser` instead of the good old `bootstrapModule` function in the apps **main.ts** file. ## ðŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction 1.) Create a new Angular app with version 14: ``` npx @angular/cli@14 new pwa-test-app cd pwa-test-app ``` 2.) Remove the **app.module.ts** file and change the **app.component.ts** decorator to ```ts @Component({ standalone: true, selector: 'app-root', imports: [CommonModule], templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.css'] }) ``` 3.) Change the **main.ts** file to ```ts import { enableProdMode } from '@angular/core'; import { bootstrapApplication } from '@angular/platform-browser'; import { AppComponent } from './app/app.component'; import { environment } from './environments/environment'; if (environment.production) { enableProdMode(); } bootstrapApplication(AppComponent); ``` 4.) ng-add @angular/pwa Run ``` npx ng add @angular/pwa ``` Answer yes to the following terminal output ``` â„¹ Using package manager: npm âœ” Found compatible package version: @angular/pwa@14.0.0. âœ” Package information loaded. The package @angular/pwa@14.0.0 will be installed and executed. Would you like to proceed? (Y/n) y ``` ## ðŸ”¥ Exception or Error 

Bootstrap call not found
## ðŸŒ Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 14.0.0
Node: 16.14.0
Package Manager: npm 8.3.1 
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 14.0.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1400.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   14.0.0
@angular-devkit/core            14.0.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      14.0.0
@schematics/angular             14.0.0
rxjs                            7.5.5
typescript                      4.7.3
I would be very happy to support you with this issue if some guidance is provided.

Issues.Title: test: ensure legacy peer dependency mode for E2E snapshot tests
Issues.Body:
Snapshot builds may contain versions that are not yet released (e.g., RC phase main branch).
In this case peer dependency ranges may not resolve causing npm 7+ to fail during tests.
To support this case, legacy peer dependency mode is enabled for snapshot builds.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test: ensure legacy peer dependency mode for E2E snapshot tests" (#23311)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): ensure full process exit with older local CLI versions
Issues.Body:
Angular CLI versions prior to v14 may not exit correctly if not forcibly exited
via `process.exit`. When the local CLI version is less than v14, the CLI will now
use `process.exit` to ensure the process exits with these older CLI versions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): ensure full process exit with older local CLI versions" (#23298)

Issues.Title: test: wait for killAllProcesses() to complete before proceeding
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test: wait for killAllProcesses() to complete before proceeding" (#23312)

Issues.Title: .angular-config.json not found in v14
Issues.Body:
Hi there, # ðŸž Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 13.3.10 ### Description I have installed the new version (v14) of angular, generated a workspace with one app. Integrated the repo with gitlab pipeline, inside the pipeline when running the `ng build -c production` it fails due to `ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/nonexistent/.angular-config.json'`. After digging to find the existence of `.angular-config.json` I found it in `~/.angular-config.json` in my local machine. I deleted the mentioned file(from my machine), and run again the `ng build -c production` but it recreates again the file but first asks if I want to enable auto-completion and then it generates the file. ```json { "cli": { "analytics": false }, "version": 1 } ``` After downgrading the angular version to 13.3.10 the pipeline worked. And when running the build production command it does not generate the `.angular-config.json` file. ## ðŸ”¥ Exception or Error 

ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/nonexistent/.angular-config.json'.
## ðŸŒ Your Environment 

gitlab runner with node v14.
**Anything else relevant?** The build command generates the dist folder locally without the mentioned error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".angular-config.json not found in v14" (#23310)

Issues.Title: ci: disable outdated Angular robot merge and triage behavior
Issues.Body:
The issue triage behavior is no longer used within this repository.
For the merge behavior, only the label status checks are potentially
beneficial but they are already checked via the `ng-dev` tooling
when merging.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: disable outdated Angular robot merge and triage behavior" (#23309)

Issues.Title: Allow custom option merging wrt multiple configurations
Issues.Body:
<!--ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…

Oh hi there! ðŸ˜„

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…ðŸ”…-->

# ðŸš€ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- âœï¸edit: -->

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

In one of the more recent releases, the capability was added to support multiple configurations via the `--configuration=a,b,c` switch.
Yet, if some of the configurations define the same properties, only last one will win (as explicitly mentioned in the documentation).
There have been several requests already culminating into [issue](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/16688) demanding builtin merging capabilities (at least for some properties, eg `fileReplacements`). These were denied repeatedly.
With non-trivial projects, the given workarounds lead to unmaintainable configuration spaghetti, where it would be pretty simple to separate the individual configuration facets.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Therefore, in order to allow developers using angular-cli to manage their projects efficiently and allow Angular maintainers to not have to deal with merging logic, *I suggest adding a mechanism which allows the project developers to conduct the merging process in whatever fashion they fancy*. 
To achieve this, add an optional callback from [src](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/f6f37821c892fbe476e0879877415dbadef5e359/packages/angular_devkit/architect/node/node-modules-architect-host.ts#L182) that allows the project developers to apply whatever magic they deem necessary. This will allow the community to create plugins which will achieve the most common tasks.

Things needed:
- add configuration property to angular.json schema to reference the external merging function
- add callback invocation (if enabled) to the code where configuration options are decided on (see above)
- callback method should look like
  ```ts
  function angularConfigurationOptionCallback(activeConfigurationNames: string[], optionsLookup: Record<string, AngularCLIOptions>): AngularCLIOptions;
  ```
  where `activeConfigurationNames` is an array of currently enabled configrations, eg `--configuration=a,b,c -> ['a','b','c']`
  where `optionsLookup` is a lookup of all configuration options of angular.json mapped by their name

### Describe alternatives you've considered

- Hacking package.json install callbacks to monkey patch the angular-cli files in question (would need to track all minor updates for breaking changes).
- Using a surrounding build tool (maven, gradle, ..) to do the monkey patching
- Throw away the sophisticated configuration and use another build tool to prepare the workspace by assembling all conditional assets and file replacements beforehand
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow custom option merging wrt multiple configurations" (#23300)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): improve resilience of logging during process exit
Issues.Body:
In certain situations the existing console logger created via `@angular-devkit/core` `createConsoleLogger`
could try to write to a closed stdout pipe stream. This would result in an error during
execution. For cases such as the completion script command, this would also prevent the
command from functioning. To mitigate these cases, `createConsoleLogger` is no longer used
and instead a logger instance is directly created within the CLI that uses `Console.log`
and `Console.error` to write output. Exiting the CLI also now waits for messages to be
logged before proceeding with the exit.

Fixes #23288
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): improve resilience of logging during process exit" (#23296)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): add i18n strings
Issues.Body:
Add i18n strings for "Start Date" and "End Date". Add `formatYearRangeLabel` to format a year of
dates in a screen reader friendly way (e.g. "2019 to 2020"). The existing method, `formatYearRange`,
uses a dash character which does not read well on screen readers.

These three new strings are not used in this commit. They will be used in future commits as aria
labels and descriptions to fix accessibility bugs.

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Typography): Defining a Level
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

In the [Typography Guide](https://material.angular.io/guide/typography) there's this section.

```
You can define a typography level with the define-typography-config Sass function. This function accepts, in order, CSS values for font-size, line-height, font-weight, font-family, and letter-spacing. You can also specify the parameters by name, as demonstrated in the example below.

@use '@angular/material' as mat;

$my-custom-level: mat.define-typography-level(
  $font-family: Roboto,
  $font-weight: 400,
  $font-size: 1rem,
  $line-height: 1,
  $letter-spacing: normal,
);
```

Instead of.:

```
You can define a typography level with the define-typography-config Sass function. 
```

It should be

```
You can define a typography level with the define-typography-level Sass function. ```
```

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/guide/typography
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(Typography): Defining a Level" (#25030)

Issues.Title: In angular cli v13 and angular material v13, getting double stars .
Issues.Body:
### Description

Hi,

I am upgraded my angular application from angular v9 to angular v13 and all other angular frameworks in the app, step by step.

Commands used were -
=======================
```
npx @angular/cli@11 update @angular/core@11 @angular/cli@11  --allow-dirty --force

npx @angular/cli@11 update @angular/material@11 --allow-dirty --force
```
=======================
Till angular material v12, the application UI looked same. However, for angular cli v13 and **angular material v13**, there are double stars on mandatory fields (.i.e. 'required' fields) selected for a particular section.

Issues.Title: feat(GoogleMap): Expose map for use with other apis
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

I have a map loaded on my screen, but I also want to use the Places Api. Although geocoding is supported by the library, places is not.

The map, and map instance, are created solely through my template
```
        <google-map [options]="options" class="col-sm-8">
            <map-marker
                [options]="markerOptions"
                [position]="markerPosition"
            ></map-marker>
        </google-map>
```

I have been trying the following code

```
        const map1: any = document.querySelector("google-map") as unknown;
        console.log("lookup", map1)

        const map2: GoogleMap = map1;
        var request = {
            query: 'albina',
            fields: ['name', 'geometry'],
        };
        var service = new google.maps.places.PlacesService(map2);
        service.findPlaceFromQuery(request, (results, status) => console.log(results, status))
```

This works in javascript - the querySelector returns the dom node, but it can be passed successfully to `PlacesService`. As I am using typescript I keep being told that I can't pass an html element (not withstanding my attempts to override the type).

Really what I want is to access the map as is, rather than using dom lookups, but I cannot work out how to access that. As you can see, I am able to create and pass options to the component, but don't know angular well enough to get the map back


### Use Case

I also want to use the Places Api which requires me to pass a google map. the obvious candidate is the one created by this component, but I cannot see how to access it

Issues.Title: bug(drag-drop): Not working with web component
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I created a web component from an Angular component with the function: `createCustomElement`.

This component can receive draggable elements. However the drag and drop doesn't seem to be common between a web component and an angular component


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
Drag an element from the Angular component section to web component section

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-drag-and-drop-example-z3dzqg

### Expected Behavior

Drag and drop must work between the web component and the angular components.

### Actual Behavior

Drag and drop does not work between the web component and the angular component.

It is impossible to drop an element from the web component to the element list of the angular component or vice versa

### Environment

- Angular: `13.1.0`
- CDK/Material: `13.1.0`
- elements: `13.1.0`
- Browser(s): `Chrome 102.0.5005.61`
- Operating System: `macOS`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(drag-drop): Not working with web component" (#25023)

Issues.Title: bug(Datepicker): Hidden calendar button not in the selected language
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was



### Description

When the locale changes for the datepicker, the calendar switch to the appropriate language. But the hidden 'Close calendar' button stay in english. This is an issue for accessibility, especially for reader application.


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/106828605/171902517-d7db98f8-daf5-4fad-a594-7e7a7bd7412d.png)


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Change locale to French
2. Open the Datepicker
3. Press 'TAB' until the hidden button appear


### Expected Behavior

The label and content of the button should be in the language specified by the locale.

### Actual Behavior

The hidden button stay in english

### Environment

- Angular: 11+
- CDK/Material: Datepicker
- Browser(s): Chrome, Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Datepicker): Hidden calendar button not in the selected language" (#25021)
